subsection_content:
Depending on the cause and the patient's condition, the doctor will prescribe separate treatment regimens. But the current popular treatment method for myocarditis is still symptomatic treatment. Some main ways to treat symptoms are to strengthen myocardial contractility, prevent arrhythmia and prevent shock, etc.
Patients need to use medication as prescribed by their doctor
Drug treatment: Patients can only use drugs as prescribed by their doctor. In case the patient has heart failure, digoxin and diuretics can be used. In cases of cardiac dysfunction, doctors will assist by using inotropes in the acute phase. The patient will then be treated with an ACE inhibitor as tolerated.
For severe cases where the heart cannot respond to conventional therapies and has difficulty returning to normal function, doctors will choose extracorporeal circulation therapy or can be understood as is a method of supporting heart function with an extracorporeal oxygen exchange membrane device (ECMO) or heart transplant for patients who cannot improve heart function.
Currently, there is no specific prevention method for myocarditis, but experts recommend that you practice good hygiene to avoid the risk of myocarditis and limit the risk of disease. Besides, limit contact with insects, get vaccinated against some diseases that have the risk of causing myocarditis such as rubella and influenza.
Please note that if you experience symptoms such as chest pain and difficulty breathing, or signs of infection or viral infection, you should immediately go to a reputable medical facility for timely examination and treatment.
